intro: Stephanophorum grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered stephanophorum, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with woody stems and broad, leathery leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and they bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
